alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Dauphin; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 6:13PM EDT until March 31 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Cumberland County in south central Pennsylvania... Central Dauphin County in south central Pennsylvania... Southeastern Perry County in south central Pennsylvania... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 613 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Plainfield, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Harrisburg, Carlisle, Linglestown, Colonial Park, Plainfield, Enola, Paxtonia, Schlusser, Skyline View, Marysville, Lykens and Duncannon. This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 215 to 229. Interstate 81 between mile markers 37 and 73...and from mile markers 75 to 81. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Very heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
